Text.Value: Embrace the dark, and Shar will help you to forget your sufferings.
*Your heart lightens as you finish the song.*
Push deeper into your head, where are these thoughts coming from?
Close your eyes and open your senses.

'O sing a song of Elturel, and when the night does fall,
Sleep safe beneath Companion's light, until the dawn does call.'
*A sense of calm settles in your heart.*

'From lowest ditch to highest thrones
All those that live are naught but bones.'
*A soothing chill runs through you. A soft breeze seems to whisper Myrkul's approval.*
This is how they honour their dead? Interesting.
A monument to the dead? Such a maudlin tradition.
Covered in dirt, to be devoured by worms. A fitting end for a failed warrior.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player looks left, then right and then kneels down. Claws at the dirt in an attempt to dig but quickly becomes frustrated and stops as it's not really doing anything.

Text.Value: Ignore the flashes of bodies which have come before.
*Your fingers claw at the dirt, losing purchase. If only you had a tool for this.*
Look around cautiously, then dig with your hands.
*You take comfort in your promise. You cannot raise the dead - but you can aid the living.*
Death is not a punishment, but just another path. In Kelemvor's name, I honour your passing.
*To be adored, to be found beautiful one last time is more than most corpses could ever dream.*
May you rest with your god, in peace.
*Though your ministry is late, you sense Kelemvor's approval of your prayer.*
*You can remember only the mangled orgy of dead flesh you've dug up, but not a single name or face.*
They should be grateful to be exhumed by one with such skill.
*This burial custom is strange, but you are beginning to make sense of it.*
*You close your eyes, imagining what Shar's final blessing will feel like when your time comes.*
*Your mind wanders to the Astral Plane. Immortality awaits, if - or rather, when - you gain Vlaakith's favour.*
I swear, I will protect those who remain here, whatever the cost.
Leave.
*There will be many more to come.*
*You catch the scent of blood mixed with urine. This person died in pain. They died afraid.*
*Or maybe... well, only if you find nothing tastier.*
You failed your people. I pray you serve better in the next life than in this one.
*Freshly turned soil shifts beneath your feet as you approach the grave.*

EditorData.NodeContext: The player has approached the grave of the very recently deceased.

Text.Value: *You close your eyes, finding a moment of peace.*

EditorData.NodeContext: The player is paying their respects at a grave. Should be quiet and filled with reverence.

Text.Value: Bow your head and silently pay your respects.
Ugh. Already rotting. I prefer my meat fresh.
*The shovel in turned soil feels oddly familiar. Within your sick heart you know: in gravedigging, you have had quite the body count.*
I hope death is more peaceful for you than life...
*Until you are free of Zariel, death will only ever be a return to the horrors of Avernus.*
Look around cautiously, then begin to dig.

Synopsis: This occurs in the DEN. The dead can be Kanon, Aradin or Zevlor. It is a recently made grave.
